title: High Prevalence of Child Labor
description: In 2015, 55.9% of children aged 7-14 in Chad were engaged in employment, with 56.7% of boys and 55.1% of girls working, indicating a significant issue with child labor.

title: Severe Maternal Mortality Rate
description: Chad recorded a maternal mortality ratio of 1389 per 100,000 live births in 2015, highlighting critical challenges in maternal health care.

title: High Multidimensional Poverty
description: In 2019, 84.2% of Chad's population lived in multidimensional poverty, reflecting widespread deprivation across multiple dimensions of well-being.

title: Significant Teenage Pregnancy Rate
description: As of 2015, 35.9% of women aged 15-19 in Chad had children or were pregnant, indicating a high rate of teenage motherhood.

title: High Wanted Fertility Rate
description: In 2015, Chad had a wanted fertility rate of 6.1 births per woman, suggesting a strong cultural preference for larger families.

title: Rapid Rural Population Growth
description: Chad experienced a rural population growth rate of 4.17% in 2023, indicating a significant increase in rural inhabitants.

title: Cultural Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2015, 48.6% of women in Chad believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for burning food, reflecting deep-rooted cultural norms.

title: Lowest Access to Electricity in Rural Areas
description: In 2023, only 0.4% of Chad's rural population had access to electricity, highlighting significant infrastructure challenges.

title: Minimal Electric Power Consumption
description: Chad's electric power consumption was just 14.47 kWh per capita in 2022, one of the lowest globally, indicating limited energy access.

title: Low Human Capital Index for Females
description: With a Human Capital Index of 0.29 in 2020, Chad ranks low in female human capital development, reflecting educational and health challenges.

title: Limited Broadband Subscriptions
description: In 2019, Chad had only 68 fixed broadband subscriptions, equating to 0.0004 per 100 people, indicating limited internet access.

title: Low Youth Literacy Rates
description: As of 2022, the youth literacy rate in Chad was 36.07%, highlighting significant educational challenges for young people.

title: High Lifetime Risk of Maternal Death
description: In 2023, the lifetime risk of maternal death in Chad was 1 in 24, underscoring critical health system challenges.

title: Low Access to Basic Sanitation in Rural Areas
description: Only 4.51% of Chad's rural population had access to basic sanitation services in 2022, reflecting severe public health issues.

title: High Average Working Hours for Children
description: In 2015, children aged 7-14 in Chad worked an average of 8.83 hours per week, indicating prevalent child labor issues.

title: Low Life Expectancy for Males
description: As of 2023, the life expectancy for males in Chad was 53.2 years, reflecting significant health and living condition challenges.

title: Minimal International Tourism Departures
description: In 2020, Chad recorded only 5,500 international tourism departures, indicating limited tourism activity.
